Class CardList

java.lang.Object
CardList
public class CardList extends Object
Represents a list of cards. Can be used as for player hands, full deck, etc.

  • Field Details

    • cardArray

      protected ArrayList<Card> cardArray

  • Constructor Details

    • CardList

      public CardList(boolean empty)
      Constructor initiallizes cardArray Have the option of empty hand or add all 52 cards to the deck
      Parameters:
      empty - passed in boolean. If true, object will be a cardArray with no card. If false, cardArray will be a full 52 card deck.

    • CardList

      public CardList()
      No arg default constructor. If no bool is passed in, it assume empty card list.

  • Method Details

    • remove

      public void remove(Card card)
      Removes a passed in card object from the hand. Looks through each card in the list. Calls the equals method of the card object to check if passed in is equal to current index in list. If it is it removes it and exits the loop
      Parameters:
      card - passed in card object to be removed

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Remove all cards from card list, clearing the hand / deck

    • add

      public void add(Card card)
      Adds a passed in card object to the cardArray
      Parameters:
      card - passed in card to be added to the arrayList

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Shuffles all card elements in the deck Using Collections utility class

    • getCardList

      public ArrayList<Card> getCardList()
      Returns the list of cards
      Returns:
      ArrayList of cards

    • getCard

      public Card getCard(int index)
      Returns card at passed in index
      Returns:
      Card object at specified index

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString for cardArray class
